name: ai_debug_actbusy
help:
Used to debug actbusy behavior. Usage:
1: Constantly draw lines from NPCs to the actbusy nodes they've chosen to actbusy at.
2: Whenever an NPC makes a decision to use an actbusy, show which actbusy they've chosen.
3: Selected NPCs (with npc_select) will report why they're not choosing actbusy nodes.
4: Display debug output of actbusy logic.
5: Display safe zone volumes and info.

name: ai_debug_dyninteractions
help: Debug the NPC dynamic interaction system.

name: ai_debug_eventresponses
help: Set to 1 to see all NPC response events trigger, and which NPCs choose to respond to them.

name: ai_debug_expressions
help: Show random expression decisions for NPCs.

name: ai_debug_los
help: NPC Line-Of-Sight debug mode. If 1, solid entities that block NPC LOC will be highlighted with white bounding boxes. If 2, it'll show non-solid entities that would do it if they were solid.

name: ai_debug_node_connect
help: Debug the attempted connection between two nodes

name: ai_disable
help: Bi-passes all AI logic routines and puts all NPCs into their idle animations.  Can be used to get NPCs out of your way and to test effect of AI logic routines on frame rate

name: ai_drop_hint
help: Drop an ai_hint at the player's current eye position.

name: ai_expression_frametime
help: Maximum frametime to still play background expressions.

name: ai_expression_optimization
help: Disable npc background expressions when you can't see them.

name: ai_frametime_limit
help: frametime limit for min efficiency AIE_NORMAL (in sec's).

name: ai_hull
help:
Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	NPC name or classname, <none>=NPC under crosshair

name: ai_nav_debug_experimental_pathing
help: Draw paths tried during search for bodysnatcher pathing

name: ai_next_hull
help:
Cycles through the various hull sizes.  Currently selected hull size is written to the screen.  Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	-none-

name: ai_nodes
help:
Toggles node display.  First call displays the nodes for the given network as green objects.  Second call  displays the nodes and their IDs.  Nodes are color coded as follows:
	Green		- ground node
	Cyan		- air node
	Magenta	- climb node
	Grey		- node not available for selected hull size
	Orange 	- node currently locked

name: ai_rebuildmessages
help: Shows nodegraph rebuild messages when enabled.

name: ai_resume
help: If NPC is stepping through tasks (see ai_step ) will resume normal processing.

name: ai_set_move_height_epsilon
help: Set how high AI bumps up ground walkers when checking steps

name: ai_setenabled
help: Like ai_disable but you manually specify the state (with a 0 or 1) instead of toggling it.

name: ai_setupbones_debug
help: Shows that bones that are setup every think

name: ai_show_connect
help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

name: ai_show_connect_crawl
help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

name: ai_show_connect_fly
help:
Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Red		- connection disabled

name: ai_show_connect_jump
help:

	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement

name: ai_show_graph_connect
help: Toggles graph connection display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are connected to the selected node by the net graph will be drawn in red with magenta lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not connected via the net graph from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

name: ai_show_grid
help: Draw a grid on the floor where looking.

name: ai_show_hints
help:
Displays all hints as small boxes
	Blue		- hint is available for use
	Red		- hint is currently being used by an NPC
	Orange		- hint not being used by timed out
	Grey		- hint has been disabled

name: ai_show_hull
help:
Displays the allowed hulls between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:
	Green		- ground movement 
	Blue		- jumping movement
	Cyan		- flying movement
	
	Yellow		- crawling movement
	Magenta	- climbing movement
	Arguments: 	-none-

name: ai_show_node
help: Highlight the specified node

name: ai_show_visibility
help: Toggles visibility display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are visible from the selected node will be drawn in red with yellow lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not visible from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

name: ai_step
help: NPCs will freeze after completing their current task.  To complete the next task, use 'ai_step' again.  To resume processing normally use 'ai_resume'

name: ai_test_los
help: Test AI LOS from the player's POV

name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_amount
help: Sets the maximum number of milliseconds per second it is allowed to correct the client clock. It will only correct this amount if the difference between the client and server clock is equal to or larger than cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_offset.

name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_offset
help: As the clock offset goes from cl_clock_correction_adjustment_min_offset to this value (in milliseconds), it moves towards applying cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_amount of adjustment. That way, the response is small when the offset is small.

name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_min_offset
help: If the clock offset is less than this amount (in milliseconds), then no clock correction is applied.

name: cl_clock_correction_force_server_tick
help: Force clock correction to match the server tick + this offset (-999 disables it).

name: m_customaccel
help:
Custom mouse acceleration:
0: custom accelaration disabled
1: mouse_acceleration = min(m_customaccel_max, pow(raw_mouse_delta, m_customaccel_exponent) * m_customaccel_scale + sensitivity)
2: Same as 1, with but x and y sensitivity are scaled by m_pitch and m_yaw respectively.
3: mouse_acceleration = pow(raw_mouse_delta, m_customaccel_exponent - 1) * sensitivity

name: m_customaccel_exponent
help: Mouse move is raised to this power before being scaled by scale factor.

name: m_customaccel_max
help: Max mouse move scale factor, 0 for no limit

name: m_customaccel_scale
help: Custom mouse acceleration value.

name: m_mouseaccel2
help: Windows mouse acceleration secondary threshold (4x movement).

name: m_mousespeed
help: Windows mouse acceleration (0 to disable, 1 to enable [Windows 2000: enable initial threshold], 2 to enable secondary threshold [Windows 2000 only]).

name: m_pitch
help: Mouse pitch factor.

name: m_pitch2
help: Mouse pitch factor.

name: m_pitch_inverse
help: Inverses (negates) mouse pitch. 0 = OFF, 1 = ON.

name: m_rawinput

name: mat_error_texture_advanced

Whether to try and replace error textures with more meaningful ones for gameplay.

1 = base color based on VRAD reflectivity data applied to texture specified in mat_error_texture_advanced_basetexture
2 = same as 1 but also replace water, grates and glass with meaningful textures

name: mat_error_texture_advanced_basetexture
help:
Which texture should be used as a base for reflectivity-based error textures (see mat_error_texture_advanced).
Keep in mind that a color value gets multiplied on top, so this should be mostly white or light gray for the best effect.
Requires reloading the map.

name: mat_fxaa_edge_sharpness_C
help: Does not affect PS3 which uses FXAA_CONSOLE_PS3_EDGE_SHARPNESS define due to being ALU bound (and only safe values are 2, 4, 8). On X360, (2.0 - really soft, good for vector graphics inputs), (4.0 - is softer), (8.0 - is sharper, default)

name: mat_fxaa_edge_threshold_C
help: Does not affect PS3 which uses FXAA_CONSOLE_PS3_EDGE_THRESHOLD define due to being ALU bound (and only safe values are 1/4, 1/8). On X360, (0.125 - default, leaves less aliasing, but is softer, 0.25 - leaves more aliasing and is sharper)

name: mat_fxaa_edge_threshold_min_C
help: Trims the algorithm from processing darks. Does not affect PS3 due to being ALU bound. (0.04 - slower and less aliasing in darks, 0.05 - default, 0.06 - faster but more aliasing in darks). Special note: when using FXAA_GREEN_AS_LUMA likely want to set this to zero

name: mat_fxaa_edge_threshold_min_Q
help: Trims the algorithm from processing darks: (0.0312 - visible limit, slower), (0.0625 - high quality, faster), (0.0833 - upper limit, the start of fisible unfiltered edges). Special note: when using FXAA_GREEN_AS_LUMA, likely want to set this to zero

name: mat_fxaa_edge_threshold_Q
help: The minimum amount of local contrast required to apply algorithm: (0.063 - overkill, slower), (0.125 - high quality), (0.166 - default), (0.250 - low quality), (0.333 - too little, faster)

name: mat_fxaa_subpixel_C
help: Effects sub-pixel AA quality and inversely sharpness (only used on FXAA Console): (0.33 - sharper), (0.5 - default)

name: mat_fxaa_subpixel_Q
help: Effects sub-pixel AA quality and inversely sharpness (only used on FXAA Quality): (0.0 - off), (1.0 - upper limit, softer), default = 0.75

Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

	All other entities drawn in pink

help: Max length of completely occluded shadow to consider a player for occlusion test. If shadow provably stops at this distance, the player may be considered for occlusion test. For longer shadows, we just don't do occlusion because we are not likely to find full occlusion when one of the boxes is expanded too much.
